s.85 defences

trade practices
where appellant and respondent were both suppliers of acoustic shock protection devices
where appellant conducted study and published report comparing appellant's device with respondent's device
where study was represented as properly conducted scientific test
where report said to imply that respondent's device was unsuitable for use in call centres and did not meet intelligibility standards required by telstra
where trial judge found appellant had engaged in misleading or deceptive conduct in contravention of s 52 of the trade practices act 1974 (cth) and s 9 of the fair trading act 1999 (vic)
where trial judge found appellant had made false or misleading representations in contravention of s 53(a) of the trade practices act 1974 (cth) and s 11 of the fair trading act 1999 (vic)
whether it is duty of appeal court to consider evidence relevant to alleged errors by trial judge and decide for itself proper conclusion
whether trial judge in better position than appeal court to assess evidence of specialised and highly technical nature
whether study had been properly conducted scientific test
whether report contained representations to effect that respondent's device unsuitable for use in call centres and did not meet telstra intelligibility requirements.
